**Archnemesis**, @, is the [Warrior](/wiki/Warrior "Warrior") [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis") in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"). She is extremely difficult, as she hits hard and often, steals your items to teleport away with them, seduces you to steal multiple items in a single turn, and ignores [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [1.1 Paralysis or sleep](#Paralysis_or_sleep)
  - [1.2 Drain life](#Drain_life)
  - [1.3 Melee](#Melee)
  - [1.4 Invulnerability](#Invulnerability)
  - [1.5 Poison](#Poison)

## Strategy

Archnemesis is incredibly ferocious in a straight-up fight. Fortunately, she has weaknesses, and a wise Warrior will exploit them: they include her predictable behavior (teleporting to the upstair to heal) and her lack of key resistances (sleep, level drain, and poison). Your strategies should generally strive to play upon these weaknesses.

Even with a good game plan, you may find Archnemesis a deadly opponent. You will want a very low AC to degrade her attacks (-20 is comfortable; you may get by with less), enough HP to survive multiple rounds of combat against her (200+), and very high [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") to ensure that you are able to hit her. Being [female](/wiki/Female "Female") makes you less susceptible to the multiple item-stealing attacks (consider using an [amulet of change](/wiki/Amulet_of_change "Amulet of change")). All of this – and the strength of the other enemies you face on the Quest – indicates postponing this battle until you have had enough time to prepare for it. Generally, you will be strong enough after you have finished the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle") and retrieved the [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone") from [Mines' End](/wiki/Mines%27_End "Mines' End").

### Paralysis or sleep

Wield or throw a [potion of paralysis](/wiki/Potion_of_paralysis "Potion of paralysis") while wearing a [ring of free action](/wiki/Ring_of_free_action "Ring of free action") or zap her with the [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep") spell or wand. Make sure you can use this method multiple times to ensure her immobility – you may miss, or she may wake up before you finish killing her.

[Sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep") is a keyword to defeat her even at level 14 – it is difficult to overstate the power of this lowly spell against Archnemesis. After rendering her helpless, be sure to hit her hard. [Mjollnir](/wiki/Mjollnir "Mjollnir") is an excellent choice if you have it, but one or two of the stronger attack [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand"), such as lightning, fire or cold will work nicely as well. About 12 shots total should suffice, again assuming your Luck is sufficiently high and you don't have too many misses.

### Drain life

Use the [drain life](/wiki/Spellbook_of_drain_life "Spellbook of drain life") spell until she croaks. It is a good idea to do this on the level above and when she teleports away (to heal the modest HP damage that drain life also does), go downstairs to heal yourself, preferably on a burned Elbereth.

### Melee

Fighting Archnemesis mano-a-mano is not recommended. She has a higher base damage than any other monster, resulting in very stable and impressive damage, and her item-stealing attacks will strip you of the weapons and armor you need to stand up to her. You are therefore opposing her strengths with your weaknesses. If you decide to go this route, make sure you are [female](/wiki/Female "Female") (use an [amulet of change](/wiki/Amulet_of_change "Amulet of change") if you are not), have high health, low AC, and if at all possible, [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage").

### Invulnerability

You may want to use a [potion of invulnerability](/wiki/Potion_of_invulnerability "Potion of invulnerability") to make this fight easier. Remember, you still need to have a strong offense so you can take her out before your invulnerability runs out.

### Poison

Archnemesis is not resistant to [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison"). You may want to use a poisoned weapon (preferably a ranged one like a stack of highly enchanted [darts](/wiki/Dart "Dart")) and hope for an [instakill](/wiki/Instakill "Instakill").
